features: 【Extendable&Foldable】This live stand is one-piece foldable design. Easy to carry around with its portable size. Can be used as a floor stand and extended up to 49.2". Suitable phones for 3.5"-6.1", such as iPhone 15/14/X/12/13/13 pro,Galasy S10,LG G7,Ulefone Note 6,etc.

【USB Charging&Wireless Bluetooth Remote】USB charge line easy plu-in such as power bank, computer, and so on. Inbuilt 1000mAh battery, can work for 4-12 hours after charging. Wireless connection ranges10M, the remote control makes it easier to take photos or videos.

【7 Brightness Level Double Sided LED】Double sided LED lights, wireless remote control 3 color lights and 7 brightness levels. This LED light is perfect for setting off your skin in different scenes and weather.
【 360° Rotate】Come with a 360°rotatable LED light with phone holder. Easily to switch between different angle satisfy your multi angle shooting needs.

【Multi-Applications】Perfect for live streaming on Youtube/Tiktok, video broadcast/recording, photography, self-timer beauty, makeup, selfie group photos, filming, online tutorial, reading. A great choice as a gift.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A good device to add to my product review tool box
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. If you often do products review on Amazon like I do, you may know how important it is to correctly showcase the product you’re reviewing. A good tripod is always something to have around, but difficult to use when it comes to overhead shots.This device is exactly what I was looking for. It’s fold-able, so easy to carry and store when not in use. But then, it unfolds into a telescopic phone holder, which will allow you to have your phone records your products at the desired height. I have a Samsung S22+ phone and this holder works perfectly at holding the phone without even the need to remove its case.This holder also has two integrated lights, which you can turn ON & OFF, control lights temperature and brightness, which can be controlled either by buttons on the unit itself, or using the included small remote control. The same remote could be linked to your phone, so that you could control it, without the need to actually need to press anything on your phone to take pictures or video.It’s very well balanced, and so far, I didn’t have any tripping over accident. It can also be used as a tripod if needed which is great and gives me the possibility of another tripod I could use for different view angles.Now for some negative that are minimal and don’t affect my five-star rating, but still good to keep in mind though:- Device needs to hold up a big phone without tripping over, and thus is a bit on the heavy side, at almost 2.9lbs.- Unfolding and setting up the device could be a bit tricky to understand at first.- This holder only come with a charging cable. No power block included.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 14, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Not Professional Quality But Functional!
reviews.reviewText: I do the social media for a small business which is primarily just basic product photos for FB/IG/e-mail and short videos for TT. T his little stand is very functional for being able to film myself and take steady product shots. I have a few complaints but none are major, and I’d absolutely recommend it to others who need something affordable.A pleasant surprise was that it’s also particularly nice for photographing pictures/documents straight down flat on a table/surface.My list of (minor) complaints:-it’s QUITE heavy, heavier than my laptop! This is great for keeping it steady but carrying it around in my bag…OOF.-you have to charge the remote and the base separately, with the same charger.-I have managed to pair the remote with my phone for the shutter, but haven’t figured out how to pair it with the base to control the lights.-if I leave it in my bag folded up the buttons for the lights are still exposed so the light sometimes gets turned on in my bag.-if it’s extended quite far, it does have a bit of sway/wobble noticeable in close up shots.-because the phone is ABOVE the light instead of in the middle like a ring light, the lighting doesn’t work as a primary light source on a face without causing raccoon-eye shadows-the phone holder is great with a thick case but not if you have a pop socket; you’llhave to remove the pop-the phone holder only adjusts (in all three dimensions) in 45 degree increments so it’s sometimes tricky to achieve precise angles on some shotsOverall a great value and I’m pleased with it!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great idea, some product flaws.
reviews.reviewText: This device is very sturdy, I was hesitant, but it holds my iPhone max pro no problem.Very cool product idea, but there are some major issues with the product that I received. I made sure to fully charge the device and the remote before using. The device held a charge just fine, but it appears the remote control does not charge (the device itself will charge and the port will light up blue, but the remote does not charge or emit a blue light).There seems to be something very wrong with the buttons for the lights located directly on the device. On this device, the buttons cannot be pressed in, they appear to be jammed. I can sometimes get them to turn on, but it’s very hit or miss. It takes a lot of finagling to get the lights to turn on and when they finally turn on, the lights will just randomly scroll through all six options over and over again like a strobe light and then turn off. Once they turn off, it’s nearly impossible to get them to turn back on.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 18, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Broke my IPhone 13 because it has no LOCKING MECHANISMS UNSAFE FOR PHONE
reviews.reviewText: I hate it I thought I was gonna like it when it first came until I realize that it swings like a pendulum because it has no locks if you accidentally hit it it will take your phone through it it will take your phone slam it it does everything to your phone it is totally unsafe the only part on it that has a lock is the main base that stops it from going all the way down the top part where the actual what you call it is if your phone is a 13 if you want to use it a certain type of way it will be heavy it will tip over and swing around it’s very unstable I have not used it since it’s still it sits around and collects dust literally and I literally hate this purchase all I did was make me have to spend more money to fix my phone so overall I hate it overall it’s an experiment that needs to be improved and I feel like I’m a guinea pig and I had to pay for them to improve it so if another one comes out with better locks on it in and things like that and I will be more than glad to use it but as long as you can walk past it accidentally hit it and it will take your phone and slam it into the into the actual into the actual pole and into the into and then fold up I’m OK I don’t use it I use it for lights but as far as putting my phone on it you’re better off duck taping it around the mechanism so it does not move I have to literally put some thing around it like a rubber band or something where the joint is to stop it from swiveling and then rocking like it’ll just if you’re not worth the money rip off they should sell it for 999 because it’s a 999 mechanism they probably cost of 23 dollars to make not even that $.50 to make so keep your money keep your money do not spend it do not say to stick with the ring light this is overrated
